column4: does anybody know why the linux-386, linux-k7 etc kernels are restricted?
the linux-restricted-modules package is something else
it's for modules with restrictive licenses
are any linux-restricted-modules installed by default with a hoary install?
linux-restricted-modules is a single package. afaik it only contains the nvidia drivers at the moment, though i could be wrong
i don't think it's installed by default
oh, sorry, it's much more that just nvidia
also wireless networking, lucent modem, isdn, .. blah blah
is there anywhere that lists what is restricted?
just a sec
is this what you want? http://packages.ubuntu.com/hoary/misc/linux-restricted-modules-2.6.10-5-386
thanks
i think he has done that already
means ubuntu supported - packages in 'main' and 'restricted', afaik
i think synaptic has a 'legend' under the Help menu
thanks
yes it does! (/me is embarressed now...) ;)
at a guess something like "char* a=23;" is being done
http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl/1835
is this an app you've written ?
no it is the gens emulator
maybe what darkheart said. are there any errors about missing #include files? (they'll probably occur early on)
